ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned more about what considerations must be made when designing software for a medical purpose including how to plan for FDA proceedings. It was like a big thought experiment with wide applications.
I learned the process behind creating medical software that is HIPAA compliant.
Great course for learning more about the software development cycle in healthcare specifically, since its quite different from consumer goods
I learned about software management, development, and review processes.

You learn about the regulatory and development process of medical software in the medical software industry. We touched on many topics throughout the semester and saw how they were all linked to getting medical software cleared and regulated to be able to be deployed

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strengths include the examples that the professor makes, which helps put the information into context; otherwise, you do not absorb the info because you do not understand its relevance.

Strengths - great science credit for CS majors. You really learn a lot about the medical software process and interacting with your mentors and guest speakers was so interesting. 

Weaknesses - some of the lectures are a bit dry. It would be better if the course were more discussion based especially with such a small group.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Having us turn our cameras on was good. Maybe some more polls throughout the lecturing? Or quizzes embedded in the lecture recordings on Canvas to make sure we can check our understanding.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This is a great course for anyone considering getting into the medical entrepreneurship or medical software design fieldessential!
Yes! Take this for your science credit as a CS major or anyone interested in the medical software field!
Yes, I appreciated learning about all the different aspects of software development. The course felt very complete and being able to develop a project over the semester was fun.

I would definitely recommend this course if you want to get some insight into how software looks like and works outside of the typical Big Tech Software industry. It was very rewarding. You get to work in small groups on your own project (that you design) throughout the semester. Its hands on and great!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Having an in-person option was really great!
We watched recorded lectures and also attended live lectures for the first half of the course. The second half of the course, we had Zoom or in-person meetings to work on group projects.
I was able to attend one in-person session
